page.title: 16Transport Bolton by Bowland
page.content: Transport is a problem in this area unless people have their own cars. There is a bus service to Clitheroe on Tuesdays and Thursdays. This is a small single-decker bus called {'Betty's Bus'}which takes shoppers to the market in the morning and back early in the afternoon.On Wednesday it is possible to go to Nelson and Burnley via Gisburn.To connect with any other bus service means a 3 mile walk to Sawley or Grindleton,which have more frequent services.Children go by special coaches to secondary schools in Clitheroe,Grindleton and even as far as Blackburn. Shopping,visiting the doctors or dentists,going to the Cinema or Swimming Baths and just travelling to school or work,takes a lot of time and organisation for families.
